channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump plans whirlwind trip to Israel and Egypt before rushing back to White House for Charlie Kirk honor
item.description: President Trump will address Israel's Knesset and visit Cairo as part of a trip marking the historic Israel-Hamas peace deal before honoring Charlie K...

item.title: Diane Keaton’s quiet activism helped preserve these Los Angeles landmarks
item.description: "I’ll never understand why architecture is considered a second cousin to painting and film," Diane Keaton wrote in 2008.

item.title: Trump directs Hegseth to pay troops during ongoing government shutdown standoff as he rails against Schumer
item.description: President Donald Trump criticizes Democratic shutdown strategy as Chuck Schumer says the situation improves daily for Democrats over healthcare concer...

item.title: Trump's National Guard troops can stay in Illinois but federal judge blocks deployment
item.description: Federal judge restricts National Guard operations in Illinois amid President Donald Trump's suggestions about invoking the Insurrection Act for combat...

item.title: Mamdani caught on camera getting chased out of Manhattan square; protester blasts him as ‘antisemite’
item.description: Video shows socialist Democrat NYC mayoral candidate being escorted to a waiting car by security agents as a protester follows him through downtown Ma...

item.title: Biden to receive radiation and hormone therapy as next steps in prostate cancer treatment
item.description: Former President Biden is receiving radiation and hormone therapy as a new phase of treatment for his aggressive form of prostate cancer.

item.title: Biden undergoes radiation therapy for cancer, spokesperson says
item.description: Former President Joe Biden was diagnosed with aggressive prostate cancer four months ago and is receiving radiation therapy as part of his treatment.

item.title: The Utterly Unsurprising ‘Revelation’ That the FBI Perused Senators’ Phone Records
item.description: Why is anyone shocked to hear that the FBI perused senators’ phone records around the time of a riot at the Capitol over which the president had been ...

item.title: Trump says troops will be paid despite shutdown
item.description: President Trump has directed the use of "all available funds" to pay military members while the government is closed.

item.title: Silicon Valley tech boss Marc Benioff says he’s all for Trump sending troops to San Francisco since ‘we don’t have enough cops’
item.description: “We don’t have enough cops, so if they can be cops, I’m all for it,” Benioff told The New York Times on Friday.

item.title: A Deep Dive in All Things LBJ
item.description: His exemplary presidential museum in Austin explores the times that still haunt us.

item.title: This Leftist Hot Spot Could Be a Haven for Genuine Political Diversity
item.description: Many conservatives understandably associate UC Berkeley with leftist activism. But it has been surprisingly open to differing opinions.

item.title: Pentagon to use R&D money to pay troops during government shutdown
item.description: A spokesperson for the White House Office of Management and Budget said Pentagon research and development funds would be used to pay the salaries.

item.title: Why Aren’t Students Reading Books?
item.description: Classroom curricula see literature as a means rather than as an end in itself.

item.title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of ‘Annie Hall’ and ‘The Godfather,’ dies at 79
item.description: People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in California with loved ones, citing a family spokesperson.

item.title: What to know about National Guard deployments in Memphis and other cities

item.title: At this rate, the price of gold could soar to $10,000 per ounce in just three years
item.description: "If it continues on its current path, it could reach $10,000 before the end of the decade."

item.title: Spanberger Won’t Condemn School Board Member For Sympathetic Emails To Sex Offender Using Girls’ Bathroom
item.description: A Spanberger spokeswoman refused to address the then-candidate's exchange of sympathetic emails with sex offender Richard Kenneth Cox.

item.title: Smithsonian to shutter Sunday as government shutdown continues
item.description: The Smithsonian Institution will close its doors Sunday as the government shutdown heads into its third week.

item.title: The Only Defensible Obamacare Deal
item.description: Employers and individuals alike must be free to choose better, more affordable health insurance.

item.title: National Guard troops sent to Illinois by Trump can stay but can't be deployed for now, says court
item.description: National Guard troops sent to Illinois by President Trump can stay in the state and under federal control, but can't be deployed to protect federal pr...

item.title: Katie Porter’s Nasty, Abusive Attitude Is Standard, Antisocial Democrat Behavior
item.description: You simply do not hear stories about berated staff from Republicans in Congress or the West Wing. Antisocial behavior is a Democrat thing.

item.title: Margaret Thatcher Docudrama Shows What Media Corruption Stole From Us
item.description: Brian and Maggie shows how a good interviewer can still reveal much about a subject that the subject does not necessarily want to reveal.

item.title: Democrats Are Giving Up On Democracy
item.description: It doesn’t matter how unpopular Democrats’ policies are, they are not going to negotiate, they are not going to compromise.
